group.name: SHADOW_LOCK
group.description: Fuses used to define read/write access permissions to shadows registers of Customer configured OTP words.

registers.name: CUST_WR_RD_LOCK0
registers.description: Fuses used to define read/write access permissions to shadows registers of Customer configured OTP words. This is a redundant OTP word hence only 16 bits defined.

bitfields.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_WR
bitfields.description: When set locks APB write access to DCFG_CC_SOCU and DCFG_CC_SOCU_AP shadow registers. (Fuse 256)

bitfields.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS_WR
bitfields.description: When set locks APB write access to DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS shadow registers. (Fuse 257)

bitfields.name: OTFAD_CFG_WR_LOCK
bitfields.description: When set locks APB write access to OTFAD_CFG shadow register. (Fuse 258)

bitfields.name: KEY_SCRAMBLE_SEED_WR_LOCK
bitfields.description: When set locks APB write access to KEY_SCRAMBLE_SEED shadow register. (Fuse 260)

bitfields.name: KEY_SCRAMBLE_SEED_RD_LOCK
bitfields.description: When set locks APB read access to KEY_SCRAMBLE_SEED shadow register. (Fuse 261)

bitfields.name: OTFAD_KEK_SEED_WR_LOCK
bitfields.description: When set locks APB write access to OTFAD_KEK_SEED shadow registers. (Fuse 262)

bitfields.name: OTP_MASTER_KEY_WR_LOCK
bitfields.description: When set locks APB write access to OTP_MASTER_KEY shadow registers. (Fuse 264)

bitfields.name: SEC_BOOT_CFG5_WR_LOCK
bitfields.description: When set locks APB write access to SEC_BOOT_CFG[5] shadow registers. (Fuse 265)

registers.name: CUST_WR_RD_LOCK1
registers.description: Fuses used to define read/write access permissions to shadows registers of customer configured OTP words. This is a redundant OTP word hence only 16 bits defined.

bitfields.name: CRC4_WR_LOCK
bitfields.description: When set locks APB write access to CRC4 shadow register. (Fuse 292)

bitfields.name: CRC4_RD_LOCK
bitfields.description: When set locks APB read access to CRC4 shadow register. (Fuse 293)

bitfields.name: CRC5_WR_LOCK
bitfields.description: When set locks APB write access to CRC5 shadow register. (Fuse 294)

bitfields.name: CRC5_RD_LOCK
bitfields.description: When set locks APB read access to CRC5 shadow register. (Fuse 295)

bitfields.name: CRC6_WR_LOCK
bitfields.description: When set locks APB write access to CRC6 shadow register. (Fuse 296)

bitfields.name: CRC6_RD_LOCK
bitfields.description: When set locks APB read access to CRC6 shadow register. (Fuse 297)

bitfields.name: CRC7_WR_LOCK
bitfields.description: When set locks APB write access to CRC7 shadow register. (Fuse 298)

bitfields.name: CRC7_RD_LOCK
bitfields.description: When set locks APB read access to CRC7 shadow register. (Fuse 299)

bitfields.name: BOOT_CFG0_WR_LOCK
bitfields.description: When set locks APB write access to BOOT_CFG0 and RKTH shadow register. (Fuse 300)

bitfields.name: BOOT_CFG1_WR_LOCK
bitfields.description: When set locks APB write access to BOOT_CFG1 shadow register. (Fuse 301)

bitfields.name: BOOT_CFG2_WR_LOCK
bitfields.description: When set locks APB write access to BOOT_CFG2 shadow register. (Fuse 302)

bitfields.name: BOOT_CFG3_WR_LOCK
bitfields.description: When set locks APB write access to BOOT_CFG3 shadow register. (Fuse 303)

registers.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU
registers.description:
Debug Configuration word (tier-1 developer). Use DCFG_CC_SOCU_WR to write lock this OTP word.
Combinations of PIN and DFLT bits and resulting restriction level:
- PIN=1,DFLT=1: Restriction level 0. Access to the sub-domain is always enabled. This setting is provided for module use case scenario where DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS would be used to define further access restrictions before final deployment of the product.
- PIN=0,DFLT=0: Restriction level 1. Access to the sub-domain is disabled at start up. But the access can be enabled through debug authentication process by providing appropriate Debug Credential (DC) certificate.
- PIN=0,DFLT=1: Illegal setting. Part may lock-up if this setting is selected.
- PIN=1,DFLT=0: Restriction level 3. Access to the sub-domain is permanently disabled and cannot be reversed. This setting offers the highest level of restriction.

bitfields.name: CRC8
bitfields.description: CRC-8/ITU of upper 3 bytes of this register. Polynomial=0x07, initial value= 0x00, XorOut=0x55.

bitfields.name: DFLT_NIDEN
bitfields.description: Fixed state of Non-secure non-invasive debug enable, when PINNED_NIDEN is set.

bitfields.name: DFLT_DBGEN
bitfields.description: Fixed state of Non-secure invasive debug enable, when PINNED_DBGEN is set.

bitfields.name: DFLT_SPNIDEN
bitfields.description: Fixed state of secure non-invasive debug enable, when PINNED_SPNIDEN is set.

bitfields.name: DFLT_SPIDEN
bitfields.description: Fixed state of secure invasive debug enable, when PINNED_SPIDEN is set.

bitfields.name: DFLT_TAPEN
bitfields.description: Fixed state of Test Access Port enable, when PINNED_TAPEN is set.

bitfields.name: DFLT_DSPEN
bitfields.description: Fixed state of DSP invasive debug enable, when PINNED_DSPEN is set.

bitfields.name: DFLT_ISPCMDEN
bitfields.description: Fixed state of ISP boot flow commands enable, when PINNED_ISPCMDEN is set.

bitfields.name: DFLT_PMCMDEN
bitfields.description: Fixed state of permanent modification commands (set Fault analysis mode)  enable, when PINNED_NIDEN is set.

bitfields.name: PINNED_NIDEN
bitfields.description: Fix the state of Non-secure non-invasive debug enable.

values.name: DAR_CC
values.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

values.name: FIXED
values.description: State of the field is fixed.

bitfields.name: PINNED_DBGEN
bitfields.description: Fix the state of Non-secure invasive debug enable.

values.name: DAR_CC
values.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

values.name: FIXED
values.description: State of the field is fixed.

bitfields.description: Fix the state of secure non-invasive debug enable.

values.name: FIXED
values.description: State of the field is fixed.

values.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

values.name: FIXED

bitfields.name: PINNED_TAPEN
bitfields.description: Fix the state of  Test Access Port enable.

values.name: DAR_CC
values.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

values.name: FIXED
values.description: State of the field is fixed.

bitfields.name: PINNED_DSPEN
bitfields.description: Fix the state of DSP invasive debug enable.

values.name: DAR_CC
values.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bitfields.name: PINNED_ISPCMDEN
bitfields.description: Fix the state of ISP boot flow commands enable.

values.name: DAR_CC
values.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bitfields.name: PINNED_PMCMDEN
bitfields.description: Fix the state of permanent modification commands (set Fault analysis mode) enable.

values.name: DAR_CC
values.description: Debug Authentication Response determines the state.

bitfields.name: FORCE_UUID_MATCH
bitfields.description: When set, debug authentication protocol only accepts "Debug Credential" certificates (DC) with matching UUID.

bitfields.name: Reserved
bitfields.description: Reserved for NXP internal (and future) use only. Users should keep this zero.

bitfields.name: DEV_TEST_EN
bitfields.description:
Enable test mode.
This bit should be clear in OTP words. But during development to test different
DCFG_CC_SOCU settings without programming OTP words, developers can write the
values to shadow registers corresponding to OTP words (95 & 104) with this bit set.

registers.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS
registers.description:
Debug Configuration word (tier-2 developer). Use DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS_WR to write lock this OTP word.
Combinations of PIN and DFLT bits and resulting restriction level:
- PIN=1,DFLT=1: Restriction level 0. Access to the sub-domain is always enabled. This setting is provided for module use case scenario where DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS would be used to define further access restrictions before final deployment of the product.
- PIN=0,DFLT=0: Restriction level 1. Access to the sub-domain is disabled at start up. But the access can be enabled through debug authentication process by providing appropriate Debug Credential (DC) certificate.
- PIN=0,DFLT=1: Illegal setting. Part may lock-up if this setting is selected.
- PIN=1,DFLT=0: Restriction level 3. Access to the sub-domain is permanently disabled and cannot be reversed. This setting offers the highest level of restriction.

bitfields.name: CRC8
bitfields.description: CRC-8/ITU of upper 3 bytes of this register. Polynomial=0x07, initial value= 0x00, XorOut=0x55.

bitfields.name: DEV_TEST_EN
bitfields.description:
Enable test mode.
This bit should be clear in OTP words. But during development to test different
DCFG_CC_SOCU settings without programming OTP words, developers can write the
values to shadow registers corresponding to OTP words (95 & 104) with this bit set.

registers.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_AP
registers.description: Anti-pole (inverse) value of Debug Configuration word(DCFG_CC_SOCU). Use DCFG_CC_SOCU_WR to write lock this OTP word.

registers.name: BOOT_CFG[0]
registers.description: Boot configuration word0. Shadow register is present for this word thus SW could access the register directly to read contents.

bitfields.name: PRIMARY_BOOT_SRC
bitfields.description: Primary boot Source. (a.k.a. Master boot source)

values.name: ISP_PIN_BOOT
values.description: ISP pins will determine boot source.

values.name: QSPI_BOOT
values.description: Boot from Octal/Quad SPI flash device using FlexSpi channel A interface pins.

values.name: SDHC0_BOOT
values.description: Boot from eMMC device or SD card connected to SDHC0 port.

values.name: SDHC1_BOOT
values.description: Boot from eMMC device or SD card connected to SDHC1 port.

values.name: SPI_SLV_BOOT
values.description: Boot using SPI slave interface using master boot mode.

values.name: UART_BOOT
values.description: Boot using UART interface using master boot mode.

values.name: SPI_FC_BOOT
values.description: Boot from 1-bit SPI flash device from FlexCom interface pins selected by REDUNDANT_SPI_PORT field. Only load-to-RAM images are supported in this mode.

values.name: ISP_MODE
values.description: Always enter ISP mode. DEFAULT_ISP_MODE field will determine the ISP interface.

values.name: QSPI_REC_BOOT
values.description: Boot from Octal/Quad SPI flash device using FlexSPI channel A interface pins. If image is not found check recovery boot using SPI-flash device through FlexComm.

values.name: SDHC0_REC_BOOT
values.description: Boot from SDHC0 port device. If image is not found check recovery boot using SPI-flash device through FlexComm.

values.name: SDHC1_REC_BOOT
values.description: Boot from SDHC1 port device. If image is not found check recovery boot using SPI-flash device  through FlexComm.

bitfields.name: DEFAULT_ISP_MODE
bitfields.description: When a valid image is not available to master boot, ROM switches to ISP mode for programming primary boot devices. This field determines the default ISP mode.

values.name: AUTO_ISP
values.description: Auto detect ISP mode. ROM monitors USB, UART, SPI and I2C interfaces for any activity.

values.name: USB_HID_ISP
values.description: Support ISP command interface using USB HID class only.

values.name: UART_ISP
values.description: Support ISP command interface on UART port only.

values.name: SPI_ISP
values.description: Support ISP command interface on SPI port only.

values.name: I2C_ISP
values.description: Support ISP command interface on I2C port only.

values.name: DISABLE_ISP
values.description: Disable ISP fall through when proper image is not found on primary boot device.

bitfields.name: BOOT_CLK_SPEED
bitfields.description: Defines clock speeds during boot.

values.name: NORMAL_CLK
values.description: Normal boot. All clocks are set to 48MHz using IRC48M, except USB block. USB block will use external XTAL clock.

values.name: HISPEED_CLK
values.description:
High-speed boot.
   o Core clock is set to 198MHz using main_pll with IRC48M as input
   o UART, I2C : 48MHz (IRC48M)
   o SPI, SDHC: 198MHz (main_pll)
   o USB: external XTAL
   o OSPI: Set to different speed using aux0_pll. Speed of OSPI interface is obtained from Boot Configuration Block present on OSPI-flash device.
       · SDR: 30/50/60/72/80/90/100 MHz
       · DDR: 30/50/60/72/80 MHz

bitfields.name: RSA4K_EN
bitfields.description: Use 4096 bit RSA keys only for certificate validations. By default the ROM assume 2048-bit keys.

values.name: RSA2K
values.description: Use RSA2K or higher key length operations to validate certificates, image and debug credentials.

values.name: RSA4K
values.description: Use RSA4K operations to validate certificates, image and debug credentials.

bitfields.name: WDT_WAIT
bitfields.description: Refresh time period for Watchdog timer. IF configured boot ROM starts watchdog timer for the specified refresh period. If the timer is not refreshed or halted SoC reset is issued. This feature is used for detecting denial of service attacks during secure boot.

values.name: WDT_250_MS
values.description: Refresh timer is set to 250 milliseconds.

values.name: WDT_500_MS
values.description: Refresh timer is set to 500 milliseconds.

values.name: WDT_1000_MS
values.description: Refresh timer is set to 500 milliseconds.

bitfields.name: TZM_IMAGE_TYPE
bitfields.description: TZM_IMAGE_TYPE field

values.name: TZM_NORMAL
values.description: TrustZone-M mode is determined by the image header.

values.name: TZM_DISABLE
values.description: Disable TrustZone-M features. ROM will always boot to a non-secure code and all TZ-M features are disabled.

values.name: TZM_ENABLE
values.description: TrustZone-M features are enabled. ROM will always boot to secure code.

values.name: TZM_PRESET
values.description: TrustZone-M features are enabled and setting are loaded from image header and locked before branching to user code.

bitfields.name: PSA_BSTATE_SKIP
bitfields.description:
If set, ROM skips computation of boot state defined by PSA specification. As part of boot state computation ROM includes OTP words 
- Shadow register values of 95 to 104 
- Fuse values of words 128 to 147.

bitfields.name: PSA_BSTATE_INC_KEYS
bitfields.description: If set, boot state computation includes OTP shadow register values of words 106 to 127.

bitfields.name: REDUNDANT_SPI_PORT
bitfields.description: FlexComm port to use for redundant SPI flash boot.

values.name: FC0
values.description: Use FlexCom0 pins P0_0 (SCK), P0_1 (MISO), P0_2 (MOSI), P0_3 (SEL)

values.name: FC1
values.description: Use FlexCom1 pins P0_7 (SCK), P0_8 (MISO), P0_9 (MOSI), P0_10 (SEL)

values.name: FC2
values.description: Use FlexCom2 pins P0_14 (SCK), P0_15 (MISO), P0_16 (MOSI), P0_17 (SEL)

values.name: FC3
values.description: Use FlexCom3 pins P0_21 (SCK), P0_22 (MISO), P0_23 (MOSI), P0_24 (SEL)

values.name: FC4
values.description: Use FlexCom4 pins P0_28 (SCK), P0_29 (MISO), P0_30 (MOSI), P0_31 (SEL)

values.name: FC5
values.description: Use FlexCom5 pins P1_3 (SCK), P1_4 (MISO), P1_5 (MOSI), P1_6 (SEL)

values.name: FC6
values.description: Use FlexCom6 pins P3_25 (SCK), P3_26 (MISO), P3_27 (MOSI), P3_28 (SEL)

values.name: FC7
values.description: Use FlexCom7 pins P4_0 (SCK), P4_1 (MISO), P4_2 (MOSI), P4_3 (SEL)

bitfields.name: SECURE_BOOT_EN
bitfields.description: Force secure image only.

values.name: DISABLED
values.description: Allow non-secure images with and without CRC. Used during development.

values.name: ENABLED
values.description: Secure boot is enabled. The images have to be signed and optionally AES-CTR encrypted using pre-shared key. ROM does signature checking first and then does decryption of authenticated image.

bitfields.name: DICE_INC_OTP
bitfields.description: Include non-field updatable OTP Fields in DICE computation. OTP values in shadow registers are used in computation for words 95, 96, 98, 99, 104, 120 - 127.

bitfields.name: DICE_SKIP
bitfields.description: If set, ROM skips computation of Composite Device Identifier (CDI) defined in DICE specification. But ROM will continue to hide UDS source in OTP and PUF (index 15) before passing control to user code.

bitfields.name: BOOT_FAIL_PIN
bitfields.description:
GPIO port and pin number to use for indicating boot failure.  Boot ROM will drive this pin high before locking the chip on error conditions. Applications can use this pin to power cycle the system.
[2:0] - Defines GPIO port
[7:3] - Defines GPIO pin

registers.name: BOOT_CFG[1]
registers.description: Boot configuration word specifying Quad/Octal-SPI flash devices settings.

bitfields.name: QSPI_AUTO_PROBE_EN
bitfields.description: Octal/Quad SPI flash auto probe feature enable.

bitfields.name: QSPI_PROBE_TYPE
bitfields.description: Octal/Quad SPI flash probe type.

bitfields.name: QSPI_FLASH_TYPE
bitfields.description: Define typical Serial NOR Flash types

bitfields.name: QSPI_DUMMY_CYCLES
bitfields.description: Octal/Quad SPI flash dummy cycles for read command.

bitfields.name: QSPI_FREQUENCY
bitfields.description: Octal/Quad SPI flash interface frequency.

bitfields.name: QSPI_RESET_PIN_ENABLE
bitfields.description: Use QSPI_RESET_PIN to reset the flash device.

values.name: NO_RESET
values.description: Octal/Quad SPI flash device reset pin is not connected or available.

values.name: EN_RESET
values.description: Octal/Quad SPI flash device reset pin is connected to a GPIO (QSPI_RESET_PIN).

bitfields.name: QSPI_RESET_PIN_GPIO_PORT
bitfields.description:
GPIO port and pin number to use for Octal/Quad SPI flash reset function.
Defines GPIO port.

bitfields.name: QSPI_RESET_PIN_GPIO_PIN_NUM
bitfields.description:
GPIO port and pin number to use for Octal/Quad SPI flash reset function.
Defines GPIO pin number.

bitfields.name: QSPI_HOLD TIME
bitfields.description: Wait time before access to Serial Flash.

bitfields.name: QSPI_PWR_HOLD_TIME
bitfields.description: Delay after POR before accessing Quad/Octal-SPI flash devices in addition to delay defined by QSPI_HOLD TIME field.

bitfields.name: QSPI_ISP_AUTO_PROBE_EN
bitfields.description:
Enable auto probing of Octal/Quad SPI flash device on SP mode entry.  
Set this bit when using secure update (receive-sb ISP command) feature with PUF keystore. So that ROM auto-detects the flash device and loads the PUF key store prior to receiving ISP commands.

registers.name: BOOT_CFG[2]
registers.description: Boot configuration word specifying settings for SD card and eMMC boot interface.

bitfields.name: SDHC_DEVICE_TYPE
bitfields.description: Device type connected to SDHC port.

bitfields.name: SDHC_BUS_WIDTH
bitfields.description: Bus width of the device connected to SDHC.

values.name: SD_1B_MMC_4B
values.description:
For SD cards use 1-bit data bus. 
For eMMC use 4-bit data bus.

values.name: SD_4B_MMC_8B
values.description:
For SD cards use 4-bit data bus. 
For eMMC use 8-bit data bus.

values.name: MMC_4B_DDR
values.description: For eMMC use 4-bit bus in DDR mode.

values.name: MMC_8B_DDR
values.description: For eMMC use 8-bit bus in DDR mode.

bitfields.name: SDHC_SPEED
bitfields.description: Speed ratings of eMMC devices and SD card devices.

values.name: NORMAL
values.description: Normal speed for eMMC devices. SDR12 speeds for SD.

values.name: HIGH
values.description: High speed for eMMC devices.  SDR25 speeds for SD.

bitfields.name: SDHC_PWR_CYCLE_EN
bitfields.description: Enable SDHC power cycle via USDHC_RST pad.

bitfields.name: SDHC0_PWR_POL
bitfields.description: Polarity of power enable signal for SDHC0 port.

bitfields.name: SDHC1_PWR_POL
bitfields.description: Polarity of power enable signal for SDHC1 port.

bitfields.name: SDHC_PWR_CYCLE_WAIT
bitfields.description: Wait time after powering down the SDHC devices.

bitfields.name: SDHC_PWR_STABLE_WAIT
bitfields.description: Wait time for power to stabilize after enabling power to SDHC devices.

bitfields.name: SDHC0_CARD_VOLTAGE
bitfields.description: SD Voltage selection for SDHC0 port.

bitfields.name: SDHC1_CARD_VOLTAGE
bitfields.description: SD Voltage selection for SDHC1 port.

bitfields.name: MMC_RESET_PRE_IDLE_STATE
bitfields.description: Reset the MMC to Pre-Idle state before starting boot mode

bitfields.name: SDHC_FASTBOOT_MODE
bitfields.description: Specifies if the boot mode is enabled in Extended CSD register of the eMMC device.

values.name: NORMAL_MODE
values.description: eMMC operates in transfer mode after power-up.

values.name: BOOT_MODE
values.description: eMMC operates in boot mode after power-up.

bitfields.name: SDHC_FASTBOOT_ACK_EN
bitfields.description: Specifies if the eMMC device sends boot acknowledge pattern during boot operation.

bitfields.name: SDHC_PAD_CTL_FREEZE
bitfields.description: When using SDHC interface in high speed modes, the auto pad compensation control logic could cause interference due to modifications in IO drive strength. Hence it is recommended to freeze the compensated value and enable auto compensation periodically in application code by putting the pad back to normal mode. When this field is set ROM freezes the auto compensation circuit during boot.

bitfields.name: SDHC_PAD_CTL_FAST_FREEZE
bitfields.description: Same as SDHC_PAD_CTL_FREEZE, but in this mode the time taken for switching the compensation from Fast Freeze mode to Normal mode is considerably smaller than the delay incurred in switching from Freeze mode to Normal mode.

bitfields.name: QSPI_PAD_CTL_FREEZE
bitfields.description: When using QSPI interface in high speed modes, the auto pad compensation control logic could cause interference due to modifications in IO drive strength. Hence it is recommended to freeze the compensated value and enable auto compensation periodically in application code by putting the pad back to normal mode. When this field is set ROM freezes the auto compensation circuit during boot.

bitfields.name: QSPI_PAD_CTL_FAST_FREEZE
bitfields.description: Same as QSPI_PAD_CTL_FREEZE, but in this mode the time taken for switching the compensation from Fast Freeze mode to Normal mode is considerably smaller than the delay incurred in switching from Freeze mode to Normal mode.

bitfields.name: QSPI_IMAGE_SIZE
bitfields.description: Any offset in memory mapped FlexSPI area could be remapped to offset zero to support  eXecute In Place (XIP) of image programmed at different offset. This allows to build all update images with same RO base address, which are programmed at offset 0 or higher offset. QSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET field specifies the offset location of second image. QSPI_IMAGE_SIZE field specifies the size multiple to determine the size of area to be remapped.

values.name: SIZE_OFFSET
values.description:
Size of the remapped area (aka second half) is same as first half. It is determined by QSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET Field. 
          Remap size = QSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET * 256KByte;

registers.name: BOOT_CFG[3]
registers.description: Boot configuration word specifying delay lines settings for SDHC and QSPI interfaces.

bitfields.name: QSPI_DELAY_CELL_NUM
bitfields.description: Delay cell numbers for Flash read sampling via DQS (either internal loopback or external DQS)

bitfields.name: SDHC_DLL_TUNING_OVERRIDE_ENABLE
bitfields.description: SDHC_DLL_TUNING_OVERRIDE_ENABLE field

values.name: DISABLED
values.description: Default： DLL delay tuning start 10, DLL delay tuning step 2 ( this config can cover most of user cases.)

bitfields.name: SDHC_DLL_TUNING_START
bitfields.description: DLL delay tuning start.

bitfields.name: SDHC_DLL_TUNING_STEP
bitfields.description: DLL delay tuning step.

bitfields.name: USB_PLL_DIV_SEL
bitfields.description: USB PLL divider value. Used for configuring USB PLL during USB ISP and DFU boot modes. The value corresponds to the PLL_DIV_SEL field of the USBPHY_PLL_SIC register.

bitfields.name: QSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET

group.name: SECURITY_EPOCH
group.description: OTP words in this block are redundant fuse words. Thus individual bits can be programmed separately at different lifecycle stages of the device.

registers.name: SEC_BOOT_CFG[5]
registers.description:
Boot configuration word5. 
- This word is set in redundant mode. Thus individual bits can be programmed separately at different lifecycle stages of the device.

bitfields.name: REVOKE_ROOTKEY
bitfields.description: Revoke up to 4 root keys. When a bit is set corresponding root key is revoked.

bitfields.name: FA_MODE_EN
bitfields.description:
Enable Fault Analysis mode.
- When set ROM checks and erases customer sensitive assets (AES keys or key codes) stored in IFR/OTP.  
- Issues zeroized command to PUF (disables key decoding until POR)
- Blocks all HW routed OTP keys and set lock bits on those registers
- Enables all debug ports and waits in loop for tester.

bitfields.name: ENABLE_CRC_CHECK
bitfields.description: Enable CRC checking of OTP words.

values.name: CRC_DISABLE
values.description: CRC checking of OTP words is disabled.

values.name: CRC_ENABLE
values.description: CRC check of all OTP words is enabled.

values.name: CRC_NXPONLY
values.description: CRC check is enabled only for NXP programmed OTP words.

values.name: CRC_ENABLE2
values.description: CRC check of all OTP words is enabled.

bitfields.name: USE_PUF
bitfields.description: Use PUF to store AES keys and UDS.

values.name: KEY_IN_OTP
values.description: AES keys and UDS are read from OTP.

values.name: KEY_IN_PUF
values.description: AES keys and UDS are read from PUF.

bitfields.name: PUF_BLOCK_ENROLL
bitfields.description: Block further enrollment of PUF block. When this bit is set ROM blocks generation of new activation codes.

values.name: ENROLL_EN
values.description: Enable generation of new activation code.

values.name: ENROLL_DIS
values.description: Disable generation of new activation code.

bitfields.name: PUF_BLOCK_SET_KEY
bitfields.description: Block further enrollment of PUF block. When this bit is set ROM blocks generation of new key codes.

values.name: KEY_GEN_EN
values.description: Enable generation of new key codes.

values.name: KEY_GEN_DIS
values.description: Disable generation of new key codes.

bitfields.name: REVOKE_IMG_KEY
bitfields.description: To implement anti-rollback feature, the image key certificate should be revoked using this field. The in-field FW update process should blow the least unblown bit. During image key certificate validation this field is compare with the certificate content (upper 2 bytes of serial number field in X.509 certificate).

registers.name: SEC_BOOT_CFG[7]
registers.description:
Boot configuration word7. 
- This word is set in redundant mode. Thus individual bits can be programmed separately at different lifecycle stages of the device.

bitfields.name: DAP_VENDOR_USAGE
bitfields.description: Lower 16-bits of Vendor Usage field in Debug Credentials defined in NXP's Debug Authentication Protocol specifications Version 1.0.

registers.name: USB_ID
registers.description: Override default USB ID's used by ROM during USB master boot and ISP modes.

bitfields.name: USB_VID
bitfields.description: USB vendor ID.

bitfields.name: USB_PID
bitfields.description: USB product ID.

registers.name: OTFAD_CFG
registers.description: Configuration word to control OTFAD key blob loading during boot process.

bitfields.name: OTFAD_ENABLE
bitfields.description: When this field is set, it indicates to ROM that OTFAD feature is enabled and should initialize the OTFAD engine before accessing the memory mapped QSPI flash buffer area.

bitfields.name: KEYBLOB_RESTRICT_REG
bitfields.description: ROM after loading OTFAD registers restricts read access before jumping to user code. Only CTR registers are writable in this mode.

registers.name: KEY_SCRAMBLE_SEED
registers.description: Key scramble data used as input to scramble master key stored in OTP.

bitfields.name: SCRAMBLE_INPUT
bitfields.description: 32-bit random value programmed by user which will be used as one of the two inputs to scramble OTP_MASTER_KEY key.

registers.name: OTFAD_KEK_SEED_31_0
registers.description:
When OTP key store is used (USE_PUF = 0), this 128-bit user programmed value is used to derive OTFAD_KEK.

OTFAD_KEK[127:0] = AES_ENCRYPT (OTP_MASTER_KEY, OTFAD_KEK_SEED[127:0]);

registers.name: OTP_MASTER_KEY[31:0]
RKTH_255_224
registers.description:
SHA256 hash digest of hash of four Root Of Trust Keys (modulus || exponent).
For i in 0..3:
  Let M[i] = BE(Modulus i)
  Let E[i] = BE(Exponent i)
  Let RKH[i] = SHA256( M[i] || E[i] )
  Let RKTH = SHA256( RKH[0] || RKH[1] || RKH[2] || RKH[3] )
Note: Documentation update needed when using blhost due to endianness issue.

registers.name: NT_FW_VER_15_0
registers.description: Non-trusted firmware version counter (0 - 255). OTP words in this block are redundant fuse words. Thus individual bits can be programmed separately at different point in time throughout the life of device.

registers.name: USER_ECC_0
registers.description: Customer defined data.OTP words in this block are ECC fuse words. Thus all bits in these words can be programmed at one shot.

registers.name: USER_BANK1_0
registers.description: Customer programmable fuse bank containing 8 independent 32-bit fuse words. Each OTP word in this block are ECC protected. Thus all 32-bits in a word should be programmed at once.

registers.name: CRC4
registers.description: CRC of BOOT_CFG configuration data. Word 96 to 100 (0x180 - 0x18F).

registers.name: CRC5
registers.description: CRC of SECURE_CFG configuration data. Word 107 to 127 (0x1A4 - 0x200).

registers.name: CRC6
registers.description: CRC of customer programmed mode fuse (Word 8 and 9).
